actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce

official_title: A bill to provide an immediate 15-percent increase in social security benefits (over and above any regular cost-of-living increases in such benefits), and to provide that full social security benefits (when based upon the attainment of retirement age), and medicare benefits, will be payable at age 60.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old- Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to authorize a 15 percent increase in social security benefits. Permits the payment of full social security benefits and medicare benefits to eligible persons at age 60.

titles.title: A bill to provide an immediate 15-percent increase in social security benefits (over and above any regular cost-of-living increases in such benefits), and to provide that full social security benefits (when based upon the attainment of retirement age), and medicare benefits, will be payable at age 60.
